element.name: Ode to Chris de Burgh by Orangetigerprawn, Multi-cache (2/1.5)

long-description.center: Lothe him or lothe him, Chris de Burgh came to mind when I paid this place a visit with thoughts of using it for a cache site.
The coordinates given will bring you to the churchyard. In order to calculate the final coordinates of the cache you'll need to visit the sign by the door and then find the preacher's daughter.
Call the digits on the sign ABCD.
When you find the preacher's daughter, the number of letters in her surname will be E.
The number of letters in her siblings names will be F.
The number of people named will be G.
The number of people interred here will be H.
So let your love shine on... Try This

element.encoded-hints: As I made my way towards the last remaining headstone, I fell to my knees, read the lines ******* *** ****** And suddenly it seemed to me I heard the words like singing in the trees.

ul.li:
2010-04-11T19:00:00Z : Found it by merann
Found it this time without any problems. We realized we were in the wrong place last time we were here. Nice spot. Out - Marble. In - Trolley keyring. TFTC, Merann.

2010-04-11T19:00:00Z : Owner Maintenance by orangetigerprawn
Maintenance visit.

2009-10-29T19:00:00Z : Found it by shorty.b
found it nice place and container

2009-09-21T19:00:00Z : Found it by Serapis
This cache is slightly topical at the moment as there was some scandal recently about a critic who slated a recent Irish Chris de Burg concert. Letters to the Irish Times were not pleased [:(!].
I don’t have much opinion about him, I do remember a teacher of mine at primary school trying to teach our class the lyrics of ‘Don’t Pay The Ferryman’. He has had one or two good songs and one or two dodgy ones also.
I was amazed I got the maths right on the first go, the West co ord is a bit complicated, what are the rules about the hierarchy of addition, subtraction, multiplication, division again[?] TFTC, TNLNSL. Serapis.

2009-08-05T19:00:00Z : Found it by theswerve
Found a bit of number crunching...TFTC....

wpt.name: GC1VP4D
wpt.desc: Ode to Chris de Burgh by Orangetigerprawn, Multi-cache (2/1.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Ode to Chris de Burgh
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: Kilsallaghan Churchyard.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Lothe him or lothe him, Chris de Burgh came to mind when I paid this place a visit with thoughts of using it for a cache site.


The coordinates given will bring you to the churchyard. In order to calculate the final coordinates of the cache you'll need to visit the sign by the door and then find the preacher's daughter.


Call the digits on the sign ABCD.


When you find the preacher's daughter, the number of letters in her surname will be E.
The number of letters in her siblings names will be F.
The number of people named will be G.
The number of people interred here will be H.
 
The final coordinates are:
N 53° (C+A)*E.(G+B)FE
W 6° C+G*4.E*F*2-(E-H)*G+H


So let your love shine on... Try This

Additional Waypoints
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:encoded_hints: As I made my way towards the last remaining headstone, I fell to my knees, read the lines ******* *** ****** And suddenly it seemed to me I heard the words like singing in the trees.

found it nice place and container

This cache is slightly topical at the moment as there was some scandal recently about a critic who slated a recent Irish Chris de Burg concert. Letters to the Irish Times were not pleased [:(!].
I don’t have much opinion about him, I do remember a teacher of mine at primary school trying to teach our class the lyrics of ‘Don’t Pay The Ferryman’. He has had one or two good songs and one or two dodgy ones also.
I was amazed I got the maths right on the first go, the West co ord is a bit complicated, what are the rules about the hierarchy of addition, subtraction, multiplication, division again[?] TFTC, TNLNSL. Serapis.
